abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the OSO Condensate Field Development
            Project in Nigeria. The primary objective of the Project was
            to assist in the commercial development of the Oso
            Condensate Field with the purpose of producing up to 100,000
            barrels of condensate per day. Bank's performance was
            highly satisfactory. Borrower's performance was highly
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            the major obvious lesson to be drawn from the Oso project is
            that, despite its large and complex physical nature, the
            financing and covenant structure was relatively simple; and
            (ii) given Nigeria's current economic difficulties and
            scarcity of resources, there is a need to ensure in future
            major upstream petroleum developments that priority be given
            first to  International Finance Corporation (IFC) sponsored
            private sector financings with the Bank being utilized only
            in its potential last resort capacity, subject to restoring
            and maintaining a viable and stable macroeconomic framework.
